alert.note: Alert for Eagle; Routt (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 6:36PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Colorado, including the following counties, Eagle and Routt. * WHEN...Until 945 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 636 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to a thunderstorms nearly stationary along the upper Colorado River near McCoy Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.4 and 0.7 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Alkali Creek, Eby Creek, Elk Creek, Tepee Creek, Norman Creek, Colorado River, Rock Creek and Red Dirt Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southern Routt and North Central Eagle Counties between McCoy and Burns along the Colorado River.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
